author: LionessExplores
content:

Visited here with my partner for food after shopping around town. Weâ€™d seen a lot of positive reviews and we both love curries so thought why not. It was quite busy inside once we arrived but we found a table fairly quickly. The decor isnâ€™t up market but for the price of the meal, you canâ€™t expect the ritz. Customer service was fair and quick too.

Now letâ€™s talk food! The curries werenâ€™t spicy enough for our taste, but they do have a self help onion, chilli and coriander bowel next to the till if you want to add more spice and flavouring. The lamb was really good and so was the chicken. Portions were big with a huge serving of rice underneath the curries. We also ordered vegetable samosas which were really good. However the garlic naan we ordered tasted funny with an artificial bright yellow colouring to it. We wouldnâ€™t order it again and will opt for a plain naan.

Overall itâ€™s definitely my new go to curry spot after a busy day of shopping or work. Itâ€™s perfect solo, with a partner or with friends. Thereâ€™s something for everyone.
